item.title: Large amount Leafs blocking payments/road, 12th November
item.description:
The autumn leaves falling has caused a large amount to cover road and payments. Residents have tried to tidy and use own green bins to contain leaves but sheer volume it’s hard to do.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London

item.title: Continued fly tipping in the alley beside Raeburn Court, 12th November
item.description:
There has been a consistent fly tipping issue at the bottom of Gracefield Gardens since the road was recently blocked to traffic. This is particularly prevalent outside Raeburn Court, the flats opposite Gracefield Gardens Health Centre. It is regularly filled with old furniture and household rubbish and is a magnet for vermin. It is both an eyesore and a health hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-8, Gracefield Gardens, Streatham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overbins, flytipping and abandoned old waste bins, 12th November
item.description:
For 2 months, there has been a broken/abandoned bin thrown upside down blocking the entrance to Oscar faber place carpark/bin area. waste disposal people haven't done anything for months. The bins are a mess. It is dirty and causing a rodent problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Peters Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing still unsafe, 12th November
item.description:
The previously reported issue concerning vehicles driving through a pedestrian crossing has improved greatly but is still happening occassionally. The issue appears to be vehicles driving west bound and queuing to turn right onto pine road. There are too many cars sat in that queue waiting for the filter light to change. When it does change they cannot see that the pedestrian light is green and they travel through the pedestrian crossing while people are crossing it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
